paper_abstract: Considering four popular Active Queue Management (AQM) schemes, we demonstrate by simulations that loss and delay of acknowledgement (ACK) packets, due to congestion, may significantly degrade the stability of a TCP/AQM system. We demonstrate that giving priorities to the ACK packets can stabilize the system. (c) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Instability effects of two-way traffic in a TCP/AQM system
